intro: Ada keiliana, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen.
